justification: “We adapted the Tiger Problem and the Interactive Tiger Problem to a single-agent Tiger Task (TT)… to better understand how human agents depart from computationally optimal solutions under conditions of uncertainty and partial observation.”

measured_by: Prediction step in the Interactive Tiger Task
justification: “Each participant needed to report their prediction of the other participant's choice… This step should elicit data that allows us to model and assess putative ToM processes more directly in our future work.”
“The ITT consisted of both cooperative and competitive contexts… In the cooperative context, the maximum joint reward occurred when both participants opened the correct door on the same round.”

“The ITT consisted of both cooperative and competitive contexts… in the competitive context, the maximum payoff to a participant was obtained when the participant opened the correct door while the other participant opened the wrong door.”

measured_by: Number of listen actions before an open action
justification: “One important characteristic of choices… is the degree to which human agents seek information prior to acting. We operationalize this via the number of listen actions prior to an open action.”
“Prediction accuracy. This is clearly the purest behavioral measure of the veracity of a participants' mental model of the other participant.”
